diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: multiple myeloma, prostate cancer, lymphoma, lung cancer, primary hyperparathyroidism, granulomatosis with polyangiitis, tuberculosis, sarcoidosis
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's acute kidney injury and hypercalcemia were linked to the milk alkali syndrome, exacerbated by hydrochlorothiazide and NSAIDs. A detailed medication history revealed increased calcium carbonate intake due to dyspepsia, leading to hypercalcemia and renal impairment.
